meanings.definition: A garment worn over the upper body, typically without sleeves.
meanings.sent1: She wore a cozy slipover to stay warm in the chilly weather.
meanings.sent2: The fashion store displayed a variety of slipovers in different colors.
meanings.sent3: In her excitement, she accidentally put on two slipovers at once!
meanings.sent4: His love for vintage clothing made him collect slipovers from different eras.
meanings.sent5: The slipover she wore had intricate patterns that caught everyone's attention.

meanings.definition: To put on or take off a slipover.
meanings.sent1: He slipovers his favorite sweater before heading out.
meanings.sent2: She slipovers her jacket quickly as she rushes to catch the bus.
meanings.sent3: Trying to slipovers in a hurry, he got his head stuck in the neck hole!
meanings.sent4: She slipovers her emotions like changing into a new outfit every day.
meanings.sent5: The magician seemed to slipovers his coat effortlessly, making it disappear in seconds.

meanings.definition: A mistake or error in judgment.
meanings.sent1: Making slipovers in calculations can lead to incorrect results.
meanings.sent2: The slipovers in his speech caused confusion among the audience.
meanings.sent3: She realized her slipovers in the project presentation after it was too late.
meanings.sent4: His slipovers in choosing the right path led him astray.
meanings.sent5: The slipovers in his decision-making haunted him for days.
